doc.title: Blast filtering for taxonomic or genomic classification.

description.text: Blast filtering with taxonomic hierarchy information for taxonomic or genomic classification.
One-line description of Blast program filtering

interface.label:
Filter the one-line description of Blast program with:
best e-value most frequent description

Number of hsp to consider (-x)?
0: all hsp
Filter the one-line description of Blast program with user name (-p)
Filter the hit of Blast with Taxonomic hierarchy name (-n)

xhtml:div.label:
Report detailed results matching "Description filter option" for all blast (-v)?
Yes No
In "res4individualBlast.txt" file, for all input blast, are details:
For all matching "Description filter option":
- query name, (query letter): percentage of matching description
and for all corresponding hits:
- Database sequence's species, accession number and letters
- Hsp description

Detailed report for database sequence(s) matching "Description filter option" (-V)?
Yes No
In "res4allBlast.txt" file, for the best database sequence(s), are details:
For database sequence matching "Description filter option":
- Database sequence's species, accession number, letters and description
- Number of query matching this sequence.
- Query name, (letters)
and for all corresponding hsp:
- Hsp description
Hsp(s) selection (-m) All hsps Only compatible hsps Simple overlaps are possible Global overlaps on database sequence(s) are possible

Produce alignment: database sequence matching "Description filter option" vs queries (-a)?
hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp merged in pairwise alignment hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp in multiple alignment hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp in multiple alignment and consensus part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries merged in pairwise alignment part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries in multiple alignment part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries in multiple alignment and consensus
For 1,2,3 hsps alignments (Sbjt and Query) are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.
For 4,5,6 part of queries corresponding to hsps are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.
Produce graphical alignment summary images: database sequence matching "Description filter option" vs queries (-g) Yes No
Blast output file(s) sort/split by specific taxonomic hierarchy (-b) Yes No
Extract Hsp(s) fragment from Query sequence(s) (-Q) Yes No
Query name write in file(s) sort/split by specific taxonomic hierarchy (-q) Yes No
Report database sequence(s) matching option in fasta file (-s) Yes No

Extraction of fasta sequences.?
Yes No
Extract fasta sequence, matching specified taxonomic filter, from file containing query sequences witch are used to made blast.

fieldset.legend: Query sequences witch are used to made blast.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: 0: all hsp
In "res4individualBlast.txt" file, for all input blast, are details:
For all matching "Description filter option":
- query name, (query letter): percentage of matching description
and for all corresponding hits:
- Database sequence's species, accession number and letters
- Hsp description
In "res4allBlast.txt" file, for the best database sequence(s), are details:
For database sequence matching "Description filter option":
- Database sequence's species, accession number, letters and description
- Number of query matching this sequence.
- Query name, (letters)
and for all corresponding hsp:
- Hsp description
For 1,2,3 hsps alignments (Sbjt and Query) are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.
For 4,5,6 part of queries corresponding to hsps are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.
Extract fasta sequence, matching specified taxonomic filter, from file containing query sequences witch are used to made blast.

parameter.name: infile
parameter.prompt: Blast output file

parameter.name: blastfilter
parameter.prompt: Filter the one-line description of Blast program with:

interface.label:
Filter the one-line description of Blast program with:
best e-value most frequent description

parameter.name: nbofhit
parameter.prompt: Number of hsp to consider (-x)

format.code: ("", " -x " + str(value) )[value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label:
Number of hsp to consider (-x)?
0: all hsp

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: 0: all hsp

parameter.name: genomic_name
parameter.prompt: Filter the one-line description of Blast program with user name (-p)

message.text: Choose only one of the one-line description filter option: User name or not.

ctrl.code: (blastfilter is not None and (genomic_name is None)) or (genomic_name is not None and (blastfilter is None))

interface.label: Filter the one-line description of Blast program with user name (-p)

parameter.name: taxonomic_name
parameter.prompt: Filter the hit of Blast with Taxonomic hierarchy name (-n)

interface.label: Filter the hit of Blast with Taxonomic hierarchy name (-n)

parameter.name: verboseall
parameter.prompt: Report detailed results matching "Description filter option" for all blast (-v)

comment.text: In "res4individualBlast.txt" file, for all input blast, are details:
- query name, (query letter): percentage of matching description
- Database sequence's species, accession number and letters

parameter.name: verbose

- Number of query matching this sequence.

parameter.name: option
parameter.prompt: Hsp(s) selection (-m)

velem.label: Global overlaps on database sequence(s) are possible

interface.label: Hsp(s) selection (-m) All hsps Only compatible hsps Simple overlaps are possible Global overlaps on database sequence(s) are possible

parameter.name: align
parameter.prompt: Produce alignment: database sequence matching "Description filter option" vs queries (-a)

velem.label: hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp merged in pairwise alignment
hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp in multiple alignment
hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp in multiple alignment and consensus
part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries merged in pairwise alignment
part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries in multiple alignment
part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries in multiple alignment and consensus

comment.text: For 1,2,3 hsps alignments (Sbjt and Query) are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.
For 4,5,6 part of queries corresponding to hsps are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.

interface.label:
Produce alignment: database sequence matching "Description filter option" vs queries (-a)?
hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp merged in pairwise alignment hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp in multiple alignment hsps blast and database sequence reference alignment: hsp in multiple alignment and consensus part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries merged in pairwise alignment part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries in multiple alignment part of queries (hsp) and database sequence reference alignment: queries in multiple alignment and consensus
For 1,2,3 hsps alignments (Sbjt and Query) are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.

For 4,5,6 part of queries corresponding to hsps are re-aligned on the reference sequence extract from database.

parameter.name: picture
parameter.prompt: Produce graphical alignment summary images: database sequence matching "Description filter option" vs queries (-g)

interface.label: Produce graphical alignment summary images: database sequence matching "Description filter option" vs queries (-g) Yes No

parameter.name: blastout
parameter.prompt: Blast output file(s) sort/split by specific taxonomic hierarchy (-b)

interface.label: Blast output file(s) sort/split by specific taxonomic hierarchy (-b) Yes No

parameter.name: hspSeq
parameter.prompt: Extract Hsp(s) fragment from Query sequence(s) (-Q)

interface.label: Extract Hsp(s) fragment from Query sequence(s) (-Q) Yes No

parameter.name: queryout
parameter.prompt: Query name write in file(s) sort/split by specific taxonomic hierarchy (-q)

interface.label: Query name write in file(s) sort/split by specific taxonomic hierarchy (-q) Yes No

parameter.name: besthitseq
parameter.prompt: Report database sequence(s) matching option in fasta file (-s)

interface.label: Report database sequence(s) matching option in fasta file (-s) Yes No

parameter.name: fastaExtract
parameter.prompt: Extraction of fasta sequences.

message.text: Query name write in file must be checked and query sequences must be done.

ctrl.code: (fastaExtract and (queryout and query_seq is not None)) or (not fastaExtract)

comment.text: Extract fasta sequence, matching specified taxonomic filter, from file containing query sequences witch are used to made blast.

interface.label:
Extraction of fasta sequences.?
Yes No
Extract fasta sequence, matching specified taxonomic filter, from file containing query sequences witch are used to made blast.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Extract fasta sequence, matching specified taxonomic filter, from file containing query sequences witch are used to made blast.
